verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> O lord,<WH3068> you have searched<WH2713> me, and known<WH3045> me.
You know<WH3045> my sitting down<WH3427> and my rising up,<WH6965> you understand<WH995> my thought<WH7454> afar<WH7350> off.
You compass<WH2219> my path<WH734> and my lying<WH7252> down,<WH7252> and are acquainted<WH5532> with all<WH3605> my ways.<WH1870>
For there is not a word<WH4405> in my tongue,<WH3956> but, see,<WH2005> O LORD,<WH3068> you know<WH3045> it altogether.<WH3605>
You have beset<WH6696> me behind<WH268> and before,<WH6924> and laid<WH7896> your hand<WH3709> on me.
Such knowledge<WH1847> is too wonderful<WH6383> for me; it is high,<WH7682> I cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> attain to it.
Where<WH575> shall I go<WH3212> from your spirit?<WH7307> or where<WH575> shall I flee<WH1272> from your presence?<WH6440>
If<WH518> I ascend<WH5927> up into heaven,<WH8064> you are there:<WH8033> if I make<WH3331> my bed<WH3331> in hell,<WH7585> behold,<WH2009> you are there.
If I take<WH5375> the wings<WH3671> of the morning,<WH7837> and dwell<WH7931> in the uttermost<WH319> parts of the sea;<WH3220>
Even<WH1571> there<WH8033> shall your hand<WH3027> lead<WH5148> me, and your right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> shall hold<WH270> me.
If I say,<WH559> Surely<WH389> the darkness<WH2822> shall cover<WH7779> me; even the night<WH3915> shall be light<WH216> about<WH1157> me.
Yes,<WH1571> the darkness<WH2822> hides<WH2821> not from you; but the night<WH3915> shines<WH215> as the day:<WH3117> the darkness<WH2825> and the light<WH219> are both alike to you.
For you have possessed<WH7069> my reins:<WH3629> you have covered<WH5526> me in my mother's<WH517> womb.<WH990>
I will praise<WH3034> you; for I am fearfully<WH3372> and wonderfully<WH6395> made: marvelous<WH6381> are your works;<WH4639> and that my soul<WH5315> knows<WH3045> right<WH3966> well.
My substance<WH6108> was not hid<WH3582> from you, when<WH834> I was made<WH6213> in secret,<WH5643> and curiously<WH7551> worked<WH7551> in the lowest<WH8482> parts of the earth.<WH776>

Your eyes<WH5869> did see<WH7200> my substance,<WH1564> yet being imperfect; and in your book<WH5612> all<WH3605> my members were written,<WH3789> which in continuance<WH3117> were fashioned,<WH3335> when as yet there was none<WH3808> <WH259> of them.
How<WH4100> precious<WH3365> also are your thoughts<WH7454> to me, O God!<WH410> how<WH4100> great<WH6105> is the sum<WH7218> of them!
If I should count<WH5608> them, they are more<WH7235> in number than the sand:<WH2344> when I awake,<WH6974> I am still<WH5750> with you.
Surely<WH518> you will slay<WH6991> the wicked,<WH7563> O God:<WH433> depart<WH5493> from me therefore, you bloody<WH1818> men.<WH582>
For they speak<WH559> against you wickedly,<WH4209> and your enemies<WH6145> take<WH5375> your name in vain.<WH7723>
Do not I hate<WH8130> them, O LORD,<WH3068> that hate<WH8130> you? and am not I grieved<WH6962> with those that rise<WH8618> up against you?
I hate<WH8130> them with perfect<WH8503> hatred:<WH8135> I count<WH1961> them my enemies.<WH341>
Search<WH2713> me, O God,<WH410> and know<WH3045> my heart:<WH3824> try<WH974> me, and know<WH3045> my thoughts:<WH8312>
And see<WH7200> if<WH518> there be any wicked<WH6090> way<WH1870> in me, and lead<WH5148> me in the way<WH1870> everlasting.<WH5769>
